intro: Trachyandra ciliata, commonly known as the serrated leaved grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves with serrated edges, giving it its scientific name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Trachyandra ciliata is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its distinctive appearance and drought tolerance.
